addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable my singular good Lord
e L. Burghley Lord highe Treasuro
r
of England

section.hand:
30
7bu
1590
M
r
Bodeley
Ortell
[.]
C
o
of states
vemt 8
8ber

page.lettertext:
fol.95r
May it please yo
r
good L. because M
r
Ortel hath certified the Councel of State
in her
Ma
ties
name, that her Hig
nes
is re-
solved, to send over into
Flanders
some
fower or five thousand men, to be p
nt
ly
imploied, w
t
e forces of these contreis, to
the annoiance of
e Enemie, it hath bin
thought expedient in a publike meeting of
the
General states
, and
e Councel together,
that an other letter should be addressed from
the Councel of State to her Ma
tie
to the self
same purpose, as hath bin written already,
about ten daies past, by
e General States,
wherof I have signified the effect in my
former letters. Howbeit, because
e winde
w
t
us hath bin contrary, I thinke this letter
of
e Councel, will arrive assoone as that
other of
e states: whiche was also directed,
as this, to be delivered to her Ma
tie
by
their Agent M
r
Ortel: whiche I thought
not impertinent, to be signfied to yo
r
L.
and so I take my humble leave.
From
e
Hage
. Sep
t
30 1590.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden
Tho. Bodley
